intro: Polybotrya corcovadensis, commonly known as the red-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It attaches itself to host trees, such as oaks and pines, through its haustoria to derive nutrients. Its ecological role includes supporting biodiversity by providing sustenance and habitat for wildlife.
